etymologies: late Middle English (in an earlier sense). From post-classical Latin rheumatizare to suffer from rheum or catarrh, to flow as rheum, to fill with rheum or its etymon Hellenistic Greek ῥευματίζειν (more commonly ῥευματίζεσθαι, passive) from ῥευματ-, ῥεῦμα + -ίζειν

definitions: To suffer from or be affected by rheumatism; to ache with rheumatism.
